businessLogic

Class ProductBusinessLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • businessLogic.ProductBusinessLogic

  • public class ProductBusinessLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the application with a working layer between the UI and the classes that access the database.
    Since:
    Apr 06, 2020
    Author:
    Coroian Tudor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private OrderItemBusinessLogic orderItemBLL
      The instance of the OrderItemBusinessLogic.java class to cascade the delete operation.

      The instance of the ProductAccess.java class to access the database.

      The list of specific validators for this class.

      Constructor and Description
      ProductBusinessLogic()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cascadeDelete(Product product)
      This method cascades the delete operation such that if a product is deleted, all the order items that contain the product given as the parameter are deleted as well.
      int deleteProduct(Product product)
      This method updates the "deleted" column of the product specified as the parameter to "true" or 1
      int deleteProductById(int id)
      This method updates the "deleted" column of the product with the id specified as the parameter to "true" or 1
      java.util.List<Product> findAllProducts() 
      Product findProductById(int id)
      This method returns the product with the id specified as the parameter or throws NoSuchElementException if it is not found.
      Product findProductByName(java.lang.String name)
      This method returns the product with the name specified as the parameter or throws NoSuchElementException if it is not found.
      int insertProduct(Product product)
      This method inserts a product specified as the parameter into the database and if the entry with the same prod_name as the product specified in the argument was already inserted in the database.
      int updateProduct(Product product)
      This method updates the database at the entry specified as the parameter.

      • findAllProducts

        public java.util.List<Product> findAllProducts()
        Returns:
        a list with all the products in the database or null if an error is encountered.

      • findProductByName

        public Product findProductByName(java.lang.String name)
        This method returns the product with the name specified as the parameter or throws NoSuchElementException if it is not found.

        Returns:
        the product with the name specified as a parameter

      • insertProduct

        public int insertProduct(Product product)
        This method inserts a product specified as the parameter into the database and if the entry with the same prod_name as the product specified in the argument was already inserted in the database. Then, this method attempts to update the previously found entry.
        Parameters:
        product - : Product
        Returns:
        0 if the insert/update was done successfully and -1 otherwise

      • updateProduct

        public int updateProduct(Product product)
        This method updates the database at the entry specified as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        product - : Product
        Returns:
        0 if the update was done successfully and -1 otherwise

      • deleteProduct

        public int deleteProduct(Product product)
        This method updates the "deleted" column of the product specified as the parameter to "true" or 1
        Parameters:
        product - : Product
        Returns:
        0 if the product was deleted successfully and -1 otherwise

      • deleteProductById

        public int deleteProductById(int id)
        This method updates the "deleted" column of the product with the id specified as the parameter to "true" or 1
        Parameters:
        id - : int
        Returns:
        0 if the product was deleted successfully and -1 otherwise

      • cascadeDelete

        public void cascadeDelete(Product product)
        This method cascades the delete operation such that if a product is deleted, all the order items that contain the product given as the parameter are deleted as well.
        Parameters:
        product - : Product
